brief_summary.textblock:
Aim of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness of osteopathy in changing quality of life
      in a large sample of naive patients undergoing osteopathic manipulative treatment.

clinical_study.brief_title: Epidemiological Study of Quality of Life in Osteopathy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  older than 18 years old

          -  affected by muscle-skeletal disorder

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  younger than 18 years old

          -  OMT undertaken during the last 12 months

          -  Any manual therapy received during the last 12 months

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in General Health score

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in Physical Component score
change from baseline in Mental Component score

clinical_study.source: European Institute for Evidence Based Osteopathic Medicine

lead_sponsor.agency: European Institute for Evidence Based Osteopathic Medicine

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
